alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Gem (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 1:33PM MDT until further notice by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT/4 PM PDT/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Idaho and northeast Oregon, including the following counties, in southwest Idaho, Adams, Boise, Camas, Elmore, Gem, Payette, Valley and Washington. In northeast Oregon, Baker. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT Sunday /400 PM PDT Sunday/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 PM MDT /1233 PM PDT/, Snowmelt due to warm temperatures over the last few days has cause small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. In addition, widespread rainfall is expected Thursday through Saturday which will likely added to the snowmelt runoff causing further flooding problems. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baker City, Weiser, McCall, Idaho City, Fairfield, Lowman, Cascade, Council, Horseshoe Bend, New Meadows, Cambridge, Smiths Ferry, Ola, Banks, Garden Valley, Goodrich, Gardena, Sweet, Pioneerville and Centerville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
